Terms & Conditions

These Terms and Conditions ("Terms") govern your use of the website operated by Climat Foundation ("the NGO") and any services provided through the website. By accessing and using the website, you agree to be bound by these Terms. If you do not agree with any part of these Terms, please refrain from using the website.

 
1. Intellectual Property
1.1 All content on the website, including text, graphics, logos, images, videos, and software, is the property of the NGO or its licensors and is protected by intellectual property laws. You may not reproduce, distribute, modify, or use any content from the website without prior written permission from the NGO.
2. Use of the Website
2.1 You agree to use the website solely for lawful purposes and in a manner that does not infringe upon the rights of others or restrict or inhibit their use and enjoyment of the website.
2.2 You are solely responsible for any information you provide or submit through the website. By submitting content, you grant the NGO a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free license to use, reproduce, modify, adapt, publish, translate, distribute, and display the content.
2.3 You agree not to engage in any conduct that could harm the NGO, other users, or the website itself. Prohibited activities include but are not limited to: hacking, introducing viruses or malware, interfering with the website's functionality, or attempting to gain unauthorized access to any part of the website.
3. Third Party Website and Links
3.1 The website may contain links to third-party websites or resources that are not owned or controlled by the NGO. These links are provided for convenience only, and the NGO does not endorse or have any control over the content, privacy policies, or practices of these third-party websites. You acknowledge and agree that the NGO is not responsible for any damages or losses resulting from your use of these third-party websites.
4. Privacy and Data Protection
4.1 Privacy and data protection are paramount concerns for the NGO. The NGO is committed to maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and security of the personal information collected from users of the website. The NGO collects and processes personal data in accordance with applicable data protection laws and regulations, including but not limited to the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
5. Collection and Use of Personal Information
5.1 The NGO may collect personal information from users, such as names, email addresses, contact details, and other information voluntarily provided through forms or user interactions on the website.
5.2 Personal information collected is used for purposes related to the NGO's activities, including communication, provision of services, responding to inquiries, and sending updates and newsletters, if consented to by the user.
5.3 The NGO may also collect and analyze non-personal information, such as website usage statistics and demographics, to improve the website's functionality and user experience.
6. Data Sharing and Disclosure
6.1 The NGO may share personal information with trusted third-party service providers, contractors, or agents who assist in the operation, maintenance, or improvement of the website or support the NGO's activities. These third parties are contractually obligated to protect personal information and may not use it for any other purpose.
6.2 The NGO may disclose personal information if required by law, legal process, or governmental request, or to protect the rights, property, or safety of the NGO, its users, or the public.
7. Data Subject Rights
7.1 Users have the right to access, rectify, update, or delete their personal information held by the NGO, subject to applicable laws and regulations. Users may exercise their rights by contacting the NGO using the contact information provided on the website.
8. Tax Deductibility and Receipts
8.1 Tax deductibility of donations may vary depending on the applicable laws and regulations in the donor's country. The NGO will provide tax receipts or acknowledgment letters for eligible donations as required by law.
8.2 Donors are responsible for complying with relevant tax regulations and seeking professional advice regarding the deductibility of their donations.
9. Use of Donations
9.1 Donations received by the NGO will be used to support the its mission and activities, as outlined in its objectives and strategic plans.
9.2 The NGO will exercise diligent stewardship and apply best practices to ensure donations are utilized effectively and efficiently. While efforts will be made to honor donor preferences, [NGO Name] retains ultimate discretion over the allocation of funds to meet its overall goals and priorities.
10. Refunds and Cancellations
10.1 Donations are generally non-refundable. However, in exceptional circumstances or due to errors, [NGO Name] will review refund or cancellation requests on a case-by-case basis.
11. Transparency and Accountability
11.1 The NGO is committed to transparency and accountability in financial management. The NGO will provide regular updates, reports, and financial statements to donors and stakeholders, highlighting the impact of their contributions.
12. Eligibility
12.1 Volunteers must be at least 18 years old unless special arrangements are made and parental consent is obtained for individuals under 18. Prospective volunteers must undergo a screening process, which may include an application, interview, reference checks, and background checks, as deemed necessary by the NGO.
13. Volunteer Roles and Responsibilities
13.1 Volunteers will be assigned tasks and responsibilities based on their skills, interests, and the needs of the NGO. Volunteers are expected to adhere to the policies, procedures, and guidelines established by the NGO, including those related to confidentiality, safety, and ethics. Volunteers should perform their duties with professionalism, respect, and a commitment to the NGO's mission and values.
14. Volunteer Rights and Benefits
14.1 Volunteers have the right to be treated with dignity, respect, and fairness, and to work in an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and exploitation. Volunteers will receive appropriate orientation, training, and support to perform their roles effectively and safely. Volunteers may be eligible for certain benefits or incentives as determined by the NGO, which may include recognition, training opportunities, or reimbursement for approved expenses.
14.2 The NGO will prioritize the safety and well-being of volunteers and provide a safe working environment. Volunteers are expected to comply with safety guidelines, report any hazards or incidents promptly, and take necessary precautions to protect their own well-being and that of others.
14.3 Volunteers may have access to confidential information during their service. Volunteers are expected to maintain the confidentiality of such information and not disclose it to unauthorized individuals or use it for personal gain. Volunteers must adhere to the NGO's data protection policies and handle any personal or sensitive information in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.
15. Volunteer Termination and Intellectual Property
15.1 Either the volunteer or the NGO may terminate the volunteer engagement at any time and for any reason, with or without cause, by providing reasonable notice. The NGO reserves the right to terminate a volunteer's involvement if they violate this policy, engage in misconduct, or pose a risk to the NGO, its beneficiaries, or other volunteers.
15.2 Any intellectual property created by volunteers during their service that is relevant to the NGO's activities shall become the property of the NGO.
16. Governing Law and Juridiction
16.1 These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Federal Republic of Germany and the European Union. Any disputes arising out of or in connection with these Terms shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the Federal Court of Justice .
16.2 In the event of a dispute, the parties shall first attempt to resolve the matter amicably through good-faith negotiations. If no resolution is reached, either party may pursue legal remedies available under the applicable laws and regulations.
16.3 The NGO makes no representation that the content or materials available on the website are appropriate or available for use in other jurisdictions. Accessing the website from locations where its contents are illegal is prohibited. Users are responsible for compliance with local laws and regulations in their jurisdiction.
17. Enforcement
17.1 The failure of the NGO to enforce any right or provision of these Terms and Conditions shall not constitute a waiver of such right or provision. If any provision of these Terms is found to be invalid or unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, the remaining provisions of these Terms shall remain in full force and effect.
17.2 hese Terms and Conditions constitute the entire agreement between you and the NGO regarding the use of the website and supersede any prior agreements or understandings, whether written or oral.
